Mayor Tom Barrett: s statement that the majority of Milwaukee police officers and firefighters do not contribute to their pensions.
Confirmation from the city pension offic: 4 percent of police officers and 87.7 percent of firefighters do not make direct contributions to their pensions.
Historical information provided by Jerry: executive director of the city pension system, about the negotiation of contracts in the 1970s that led to the city covering both the employee and employer contributions to the pension fund.
Testimony from John Barmore: vice president of the Milwaukee Professional Fire Fighters union, and Mike Crivello, president of the Milwaukee Police Association union, supporting the fact that employees have indirectly contributed to their pensions through concessions on wage increases.
